summary:
Okay, so my mom and my brothers will be gone awhile for a trip to Michigan and Indiana.
My mom will be gone when my bigger more...
body:
Okay, so my mom and my brothers will be gone awhile for a trip to Michigan and Indiana.

My mom will be gone when my bigger more expensive purchases are supposed to arrive such as my 3DS and The Art of Making Detective Pikachu, the harder to hide purchases when coming back from the mailbox.

So I shouldn’t have to worry too much about bring forced or guilted into returning my purchases, despite it being purely my hard earned money from work and me being 18.

These are the only big purchases I have wanted, so I’ll be saving a lot of my paychecks from this point forward.

title: Pokémon: Detective Pikachu
body:
Though I have not played the last two generations of Pokémon games, I still consider myself a Pokémon fan, so any review of “Pokémon: Detective Pikachu” is likely to be heavily biased. Therefore, to be balanced, I have a series of pairs of Pros and Cons.

CON: Ryan Reynolds instead of Danny Devito as Pikachu
PRO: Pikachu is not PG-rated Deadpool, but its own fun character.

CON: Only two short 1v1 Pokémon battles.
PRO: Jigglypuff sings a person to sleep, Machamp as a traffic guard, Charmander uses tail to heat stir fry, Loudred as speakers.

CON: Lickitung is unnervingly gross
PRO: Lickitung is unnervingly gross, as a realistic small, pink, squishy dinosaur with a tongue twice its size should be.

CON: Katheryn Newton’s ridiculous overacting
PRO: Katheryn Newton’s overacting reminiscent of the anime

PRO: Mr. Mime
CON: Not enough Mr. Mime

CON: Why is Snorlax so small?
PRO: Snorlax is actually only 6’11’ (2.1m), so it is an accurate depiction of its size. Most people think Pokémon are a lot bigger than they actually are.

CON: Only one scene of a Pokémon evolving, and it is shown almost as an afterthought
PRO: Bill Nighy and the weird evolution scheme

CON: Recycling Mewtwo as an antagonist (sort of)
PRO: Recylcing Mewtwo as an antagonist (sort of) and lots of other fan service for older fans: Pikachu, Psyduck in prominent roles and Togepi and Jigglypuff sightings, all of whom had prominent rolls in the anime. The MacGuffin is formula R (for Team Rocket)

BUT there is one, disgustingly upsetting flaw, that does not have any Pro to balance it with. I get you cant have all 809 pokemon in the movie. They decided to go with about 60 different species. I am disappointed that Dunsparce, Shuckle, and Probopass weren’t included, but I accept that. They have to save something for the sequels.


But they decided to have:

Audino

a boring… something


But no Vanillite


Graveler

A stupid rock with hands

BUT NO Vanillish

Emolga

An electric rodent no one cares about

BUT NO Vannilux.

Unforgivable.

0/10

blog.name: rising-up-from-the-ashes
blog.title: My Beautiful Journey...
blog.description:
J / 28 / UK

Mental Health Warrior // Self Love Advocate // Happiness Seeker

💛🌻💛

Started back in 2014 to record my weight loss, at one point losing 6+ stone.

In the last 18 months i've struggled to maintain the loss and mid 2017 i had a mental breakdown. In the time since i’ve sought medical help for my mental illnesses, now on meds, been through CBT and realising this journey isn't just about weight loss. It's about me living as my true self, taking each day as it comes.

Previously called this-beautiful-journey-of-mine

summary: So, Detective Pikachu’s finally crossed $400 million at the worldwide box office. Still not the highest grossing movie based on...
body:
So, Detective Pikachu’s finally crossed $400 million at the worldwide box office.

Still not the highest grossing movie based on a video game, Rampage and Warcraft still have it beat by several million and there’s a chance it won’t surpass either of them.

Interestingly, I think it’s mostly because those movies did a lot better in China though. I don’t have current estimates, but 2 weeks ago Detective Pikachu had grossed about $84.4 million in China, whereas Rampage made $156 million in it’s lifetime, and Warcraft made $221 million there.

What’s interesting is that Detective Pikachu easily has both films beat in the united states though, where so far it’s made $137.4 million (Less than $13 million off from it’s total budget). Rampage by comparison made $101 million, while Warcraft earned a rather pathetic-looking by comparison $47.4 million.

That last part is extremely important, because Warcraft cost only $10 million more to make (I’m not sure how each film cost to market though), but it was considered a financial disappointment for the studio because they make back more money from ticket sales in the united states, and far less from the Chinese box office earnings.

So while Detective Pikachu may end up making slightly less than Warcraft, all things considered it’s probably a more financially successful movie by far thanks to it’s more substantial success in America. Not even mentioning any money the various studios and the Pokémon company will probably make on merchandise, and Pokémon is the highest grossing media franchise in history in large part because of it’s extremely high merchandise sales, sooo…

yeah. All things considered, it’s looking good for Detective Pikachu. I’d have liked it to have grossed at least a 100 million more, but we can at least say it’s a decent success. And it’s pretty well liked and regarded as good, so, yeah. 

I predict good things for the sequel and potential future live action Pokémon movies so long as they’re good.

summary: The way the Snubbull from Detective Pikachu acted differently while on duty and while alone with his human partner was all very...
body:
The way the Snubbull from Detective Pikachu acted differently while on duty and while alone with his human partner was all very brief but easily one of the most important, establishing bits of the movie.

It shows how pokemon and humans are indeed close, that pokemon can fill human roles and be very dedicated at them (he was being the bad cop) and that not everything is what it seems at first.

It subconsciously prepares us for a lot of things that happen later.
